alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 23 at 3:32PM CDT until September 23 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN OKMULGEE AND EAST CENTRAL OKFUSKEE COUNTIES... At 330 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northeast of Pharoah, moving east at 15 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR Henryetta. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Henryetta... Dewar... Schulter... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 232 and 239. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
